QuestionText: How will climate risk be integrated into property insurance pricing in wildfire-prone areas of California over the next decade?
ResponseText:
### Question  
Do not consider human in the loop, use all the tools and agent you can access to provide the better response to the following question: How will climate risk be integrated into property insurance pricing in wildfire-prone areas of California over the next decade?.

### Short answer (1-line)  
Climate risk will increasingly be integrated into property insurance pricing in wildfire-prone California through advanced catastrophe modeling, incorporation of real-time risk data, and regulatory adjustments, leading to higher premiums and greater price differentiation based on wildfire exposure.

### Executive summary (≤ 120 words)  
Over the next decade, property insurers in wildfire-prone areas of California are expected to rely more heavily on advanced catastrophe risk models, granular geographic and vegetation data, and real-time climate analytics to price policies. Climate risk will be quantified using predictive tools, satellite imagery, and local hazard data, which will result in more accurate reflection of wildfire exposure at the property level. Regulatory frameworks may evolve to allow more dynamic pricing, but could create tension around affordability and accessibility for high-risk properties. Opportunities include incentivizing risk-reducing property improvements, while risks involve potential insurance market withdrawals and coverage gaps for the most vulnerable communities.
